result.execSummary:
The defendant Angel L Rosario was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
- The Court ordered that all MANDATORY court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
The Court WAIVED all non-mandatory costs due to indigency.

- No contact with firearms.
- The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
- The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
- Upon successful completion of probation and no new law violations rising to the level of probable cause, the Court will grant expungement.
- No driving without a valid license.

- Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
- Supervision in the Mental Health Unit. 
- Psychological Evaluation; take all prescribed medications. 
- ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY; random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel L Rosario

defendant.name: Rosario, Angel L
defendant.address: 3461 East Bonnie Drive, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Angel L Rosario in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Sentencing.   Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction;  with credit for 0 DAYS served.  

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction STAYED per agent's review. 
The Court ordered that all MANDATORY court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
The Court WAIVED all non-mandatory costs due to indigency.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
Supervision in the Mental Health Unit. 
Psychological Evaluation; take all prescribed medications. 
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY; random urine screens.
Seek and maintain employment.
Perform 40 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.
No contact with firearms.
No driving without a valid license. 
Upon successful completion of probation and no new law violations rising to the level of probable cause, the Court will grant expungement. 

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.

Defendant Angel L Rosario in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Plea Hearing.   Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire and jury instruction received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint/Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record. 

The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing, branch 38.

e-FILED: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Angel L Rosario in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Patrick J Leigl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appear via zoom.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea hearing. Court will accept misdemeanor case for global resolution.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.

Adjustment Number: 22A 005017,
Payable Number: 979892,
Receipt Number: 22RP002541,
Amount: $20.00

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br. 38

Defendant Angel L Rosario in court with Attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.
Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/18/22 @ 1p
